titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: Still the bright warm weather. I worked at the lectures, and talked to my Swede, who lunched with Bannister at Ledbury. He read through the part of my lectures which have been written. I gather that he desires me to say something in favour of Establishment, something which might be serviceable in Sweden where the question has still an importance of its own. Lilley came to dinner.
